title: Falsehood in Wartime: Propaganda Lies of the First World War
description: [Arthur Augustus William Harry Ponsonby, 1st Baron Ponsonby of Shulbrede (16 February 1871 - 23 March 1946) was a British politician, writer, and social activist. He was the third son of Sir Henry Ponsonby, Private Secretary to Queen Victoria. Lord Ponsonby is probably most remembered for the statement: "When war is declared, truth is the first casualty." The following was scanned and posted by Geoffrey Miller, on the WWI Listserve. ]
author: Arthur Ponsonby
